column3: b'3-WORD BOOK TITLES BY MIDDLE WORD'
column7: b'The jackal was called this big cat\'s "provider": it was thought to assist on hunts'
column8: b'The murderous Mr. Edward Hyde was created by this author'
column10: b'(Jeff Probst, the host of Survivor, presents the clue.) The weather upped the stakes for "Survivor: Millennials vs. Gen X". The castaways had to be temporarily evacuated from their camps due to Zena, this tropical storm that can also be called a hurricane or a typhoon'
column11: b'A Guinness World Record, Hans Langseth\'s over 17-foot-long beard was eventually cut & donated to this D.C. institution'
column12: b'You "pull" one of these by staying up very late until that term paper is finally finished'
column13: b'Some jackals use mounds abandoned by these ant-like insects as dens to birth their pups'
column14: b'Enacted by Congress in response to this 1973 Supreme Court case, the Hyde Amendment limits public funding for abortions'
column16: b'(Jeff Probst, the host of Survivor, presents the clue.) In 1882 Germany, Austria-Hungary & Italy formed a secret pact called the Triple this. On the first season of "Survivor", Richard formed a quadruple one with Sue, Rudy & Kelly in which the four voted as a bloc, a wildly successful strategy that set a precedent for the series'
column17: b'In 1860 11-year-old Grace Bedell of New York sent a letter urging him to "let your whiskers grow", & he did!'
column18: b'Synonym for a rabble-rouser who fires up a mob'
column19: b'This African country gave its name to a canine that is also known as the Abyssinian wolf & the Simien jackal'
column20: b'Founder of the Gaelic League, Douglas Hyde was also the first president of this republic'
column22: b'(Jeff Probst, the host of Survivor, presents the clue.) I knew that "Survivor" needed a catchphrase for when I snuffed out a torch at tribal council. It was actually executive producer Mark Burnett who inadvertently came up with this iconic 4-word phrase & the rest is TV history'
column23: b'By the time he died, still unshaven in 1923, his discovery, the X-ray, was an essential tool of medicine'
column24: b"This item near a car's radio evolved into a 12-volt accessory charger"
column25: b'This Russian airline has bred dog-jackal hybrids to sniff out explosives'
column26: b'Anne Hyde was the mother of 2 British queens, Anne & this woman who married William III'
column28: b'(Jeff Probst, the host of Survivor, presents the clue.) A fan favorite from "Survivor: The Australian Outback", she went on to co-host "The View" & "Fox & Friends"'
column29: b'This bearded French physician published the first edition of "Centuries", containing his prophecies, in 1555'
column30: b'After 8 years in the job in Dallas, Mike Rawlings said, "A mayor needs to" be this, bringing folks together'
column31: b'Jackals in Africa can transmit this disease AKA lyssa to dogs & other animals'
column32: b'An 1872 act of Parliament allowed anyone to talk in this "Corner" of London\'s Hyde Park'
column34: b'(Jeff Probst, the host of Survivor, presents the clue.) The castaways on "Survivor: China" visited the Great Wall & the Shaolin Temple, home of kung fu; for help with strategy the tribes were given this book that Sun Tzu wrote more than 2,500 years ago, though its tactics apply to "Survivor" as if it had been written today'
column35: b'Stop the presses. Here\'s an image of this bearded 15th century German inventor'
column36: b'Anatomical term for someone who talks spitefully about an absent person'
column73: b'In the 1540s Francisco de Orellana made the first known trip down its entire length'
column74: b'1790: "an act providing for the enumeration of the inhabitants of the United States"'
column75: b"This song was written in 1908 & over 100 years later it's still sung during the seventh-inning stretch"
column76: b"Adair, Iowa & Makanda, Illinois have put this cheerful symbol, big in the '70s, on their water towers"
column77: b'This Dutch artist often painted his beloved wife Saskia, who died in 1642 at age 29'
column79: b'Dusseldorf & Mainz are important cities on this river'
column80: b'1790: "an act for the encouragement of learning, by securing the copies of maps, charts, and books, to the authors"'
column81: b'In the 1980s Cyndi Lauper & Wham! were among the artists who made their early U.S. TV appearances on this Dick Clark series'
column82: b'For at least one day in December, the sun does not set south of this circle'
column83: b'Anna McNeill was arranged in grey & black for a work by this artist, her son'
column85: b"The Thar Desert of Northwestern India stretches into Pakistan & this river's valley"
column86: b'2001: "an act to deter and punish terrorist acts in the United States and around the world"'
column87: b'In 2019 Aaron Paul reprised his role as Jesse Pinkman for this "Breaking Bad" movie'
column89: b'Teenaged ballerina Marie van Goethem was the model for his sculpture of the "Little Dancer"'
column91: b'It\'s name means swiftly flowing river and it crosses the province of the same name, the northern and southern branches meeting near Prince Albert'
column92: b'1965: "an act to enforce the Fifteenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States, and for other purposes"'
column93: b'A resort area in the Catskills where many Jewish entertainers got their start had this alliterative nickname'
column94: b'1989 film in which Keanu Reeves tells Alex Winter, "Strange things are afoot at the Circle K"'
column95: b'Between 1971 & 1985 this artist painted Helga Testorf, his neighbor in Chadds Ford, Pennsylvania'
column97: b'Not the Seine but this river that enters the Atlantic south of Brittany is the longest in France'
column99: b'AFI\'s first "100 Greatest American Movies" list included this D.W. Griffith silent epic; on an updated list, it was gone'
column100: b'(Sarah of the Clue Crew presents by a display monitor.) The path of any point on the smaller circle will trace the diameter of the larger circle as the smaller circle rolls inside, according to the theorem of this Polish astronomer and mathematician'
column101: b'Jeanne H\xc3\xa9buterne had a slightly shorter neck than depicted in the works of her beau, this Italian painter'
column105: b'"Take Me Out To The Ball Game"'
column134: b'This 2007 movie came to Broadway with an all-female creative team including book & direction and with songs by pop star Sara Bareilles'
